perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, the Trust is engaged in business as an open-end investment company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended, and consists of one or more series; and
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, the Trust is engaged in business as an investment vehicle and may or may not be considered an investment company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended, and consists of one or more series; and
perturbation.explanation: By stating the Trust may or may not be registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940, the contract creates a direct contradiction. The original text indicates it IS an investment company, whereas the change introduces uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: The Sponsor shall not be liable for any error of judgment or mistake of law or for any act or omission in the oversight, administration or management of the Trust or the performance of its duties hereunder, except for willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence in the performance of its duties, or by reason of the reckless disregard of its obligations and duties hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: The Sponsor shall not be liable for any error of judgment or mistake of law, act or omission. The Sponsor's liability extends only to instances of intentional misconduct proven beyond a reasonable doubt.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the exceptions for 'willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence' and raises the standard for liability to 'intentional misconduct proven beyond a reasonable doubt.' This contradicts standard fiduciary duty requirements which hold investment sponsors to a standard that includes negligence and bad faith.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Massachusetts State Law regarding Fiduciary Duty and the Investment Company Act of 1940

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be construed and enforced and interpreted in accordance with and governed by the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts without reference to principles of conflicts of law.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be construed and enforced and interpreted in accordance with principles of equity and fairness, as determined at the sole discretion of the Sponsor, without regard to the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts or principles of conflicts of law.
perturbation.explanation: By stating that the agreement will be governed by principles of equity and fairness, as determined at the sole discretion of the Sponsor, it makes the contract unenforceable. The reference to Massachusetts law is removed and the power to interpret 'equity and fairness' is given to one party. This introduces legal uncertainty and contradicts fundamental contract law principles.
